title: Altar Cloth with Phoenix and the Three Star Deities
content:
accession_no_csv: 2016-00718

  Image: 

  object_work_type: altar cloths

  title_text: Altar Cloth with Phoenix and the Three Star Deities

  preference: main

  title_language: 

  creation_date: late 19th-20th century

  creation_place_original_location: Straits Settlements

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: paper (fiber product) metal thread paint (coating)

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique) embroidering painting (image-making)

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is an altar cloth. It is embroided with depictions of the figures of deities
 against a background of gold thread. The faces of the figures are painted on paper and attached to the altar cloth. The top panel features a pair of phoenixes flanking a lotus bloom flower.

  subject_terms_1: deities Peranakan birds (motifs) flower (motif)

  subject_terms_2: Altar-cloths Motifs Peranakan (Asian people) Gods

  subject_terms_3: Religious life and practices Textile art and design

  sgcool_label_text: The figures of the Three Star deities
 of happiness
 status and longevity
 are embroidered on this altar cloth
 against a background of gold thread. The faces
 including that of the two attendant figures seem to have been painted on paper and attached to the fabric. The top panel features a pair of phoenix flanking a lotus bloom. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.

metadata.title_text: Altar Cloth with Phoenix and the Three Star Deities
metadata.physical_appearance: This is an altar cloth. It is embroided with depictions of the figures of deities, against a background of gold thread. The faces of the figures are painted on paper and attached to the altar cloth. The top panel features a pair of phoenixes flanking a lotus bloom flower.
metadata.subject_terms_3: Religious life and practices Textile art and design
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The figures of the Three Star deities, of happiness, status and longevity, are embroidered on this altar cloth, against a background of gold thread. The faces, including that of the two attendant figures seem to have been painted on paper and attached to the fabric. The top panel features a pair of phoenix flanking a lotus bloom. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
